titles.title: Aikatsu! Idol Katsudou!
Aikatsu! Idol Activities!
アイカツ! アイドルカツドウ!
Aikatsu!
偶像活动

relatedanime.anime: Aikatsu! Nerawareta Mahou no Aikatsu! Card
Aikatsu! Music Award: Minna de Shou o Moraccha Ima Show!

anime.description: * An original anime by Sunrise, originally developed as a concept for a data carddass series by Bandai and released simultaneously with Bandai`s trading card arcade game by the same name. http://anidb.net/ch47564 [Hoshimiya Ichigo] is a normal girl in her 1st year of middle-school. However, her life changes drastically when, at her good friend http://anidb.net/ch47567 [Aoi]`s invitation, she is admitted into Starlight Academy, a famous school for grooming idols. In the weeks and months to come, Ichigo meets many rivals, learns the skills of being an idol, and, using her Aikatsu! card, enters numerous auditions. ~ translated and adapted from official site by Cranston

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: school dormitory
tag.description: A school dormitory or residence hall is the student living quarters at an elite academy, boarding school, or military school. The main characters may live or work at the dormitory, and it often becomes the backdrop for a reoccurring part of the story.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: henshin
tag.description: Japanese for "transformation" (metamorphosis or disguise). A "henshin anime" is any anime, where the characters or their costumes transform, such as Sailor Moon. The henshin switches on the character`s special powers, and is frequently accompanied by a costume change. Often the change of clothing is the only outward indicator that the character has changed and yet nobody seems to notice the hero`s true self. Most henshin heroes have a special item which they use to change into their heroic form. These items are usually activated by a command phrase (which is often in Engrish, for some reason), triggering a transformation sequence.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

character.name: Oota Kakeru
character.description: Oota Kakeru is http://anidb.net/ch47564 [Hoshimiya Ichigo]`s second fan. He`s also a member of his school`s track team.

character.name: Tachibana Anna
character.description: Tachibana Anna is the head designer of http://anidb.net/ch80638 [Spicy Ageha].

character.name: Amahane Asuka
character.description: Amahane Asuka is the head designer of http://anidb.net/ch80613 [Angely Sugar]. She also designs and hand-makes every Angely Bear.

character.name: Nijigahara Makoto
character.description: Nijigahara Makoto is the head designer of http://anidb.net/ch80637 [Happy Rainbow].

character.name: Inamura Ikuyo
character.description: Inamuya Ikuyo is an elderly lady who enlists http://anidb.net/ch51615 [Arisugawa Otome] in order to find a camphor tree that reminds her of her first love.

character.name: Toudou Yurika
character.description: Toudou Yurika is an idol who portrays herself as a vampire in public. She claims to be over 600 years old, http://anidb.net/ch73415 [Dracula]`s descendant, and Carmilla`s daughter. Note: Carmilla is a female vampire and the title character of a 1871-72 Gothic novella by Joseph Sheridan Le Fanu and one of the early works of vampire fiction, predating Bram Stoker`s Dracula, published in 1897, by a quarter of century, and being one of the major influences upon the latter.

character.name: Yumekouji Maya
character.description: Yumekouji Maya is the head designer of http://anidb.net/ch80636 [Loli Gothic]. He claims to be over 300 years old and lives in a "haunted" mansion.

character.name: Green Grass
character.description: Green Grass is the reclusive top designer of http://anidb.net/ch80612 [Aurora Fantasy] and a picture book author. Behind the scenes, Green Grass is actually the joint effort of twins http://anidb.net/ch57989 [Hiiragi Elena] and http://anidb.net/ch57988 [Hiiragi Risa].

character.name: Hiiragi Risa
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch57989 [Hiiragi Elena] and Hiiragi Risa are identical twins. Because they look the exact same, do the same things the same way, and never introduced themselves separately, it is unknown who among the two is Elena and who is Risa.

character.name: Hiiragi Elena
character.description: Hiiragi Elena and http://anidb.net/ch57988 [Hiiragi Risa] are identical twins. Because they look the exact same, do the same things the same way, and never introduced themselves separately, it is unknown who among the two is Elena and who is Risa.

character.name: Souma Yuuta
character.description: Souma Yuuta is an actor who plays http://anidb.net/ch47564 [Hoshimiya Ichigo]`s younger brother in a commercial for http://anidb.net/ch80613 [Angely Sugar]`s Angely Bear.

character.name: Ichinose Kaede
character.description: Ichinose Kaede is an idol from America. Her goal is to make people smile. To that end in addition to being an idol, she is also a magician and performs stunts such as sky diving into an audition. She has also done commercials for her father`s chain of sushi restaurants, "Kaede Sushi".

character.name: Ichihara Ichika
character.description: Ichihara Ichika is an idol who participated alongside http://anidb.net/ch47565 [Kanzaki Mizuki] in the latter`s first team audition.

character.name: Miura Sango
character.description: IMiura Sango is an idol who participated alongside http://anidb.net/ch47565 [Kanzaki Mizuki] in the latter`s first team audition.

character.name: Nishijima Nino
character.description: Nishijima Nino is an idol who participated alongside http://anidb.net/ch47565 [Kanzaki Mizuki] in the latter`s first team audition.

character.name: Kurosaki Kantoku
character.description: Kurosaki is the director of the Swallowtail franchise.

character.name: Himesato Maria
character.description: Himesato Maria is one of the main characters in the second season. She is formally introduced as the fourth main girl representing the Dream Academy community.

character.name: Natsuki Mikuru
character.description: Natsuki Mikuru is one of the main characters in Season 2. She is partnered with Kanzaki Mizuki, forming the duo unit WM. Her primary brand is Vivid Kiss.

character.name: Oozora Akari
character.description: Oozora Akari is one of the new main characters for the Starlight Academy community who debuts in the second half of the anime. During her early appearances, Akari had long hair and wore a pink bow, due to the fact that she was a huge fan of Ichigo. By Episode 96, Akari`s hair remains layered, but has grown to where it`s medium length.

character.name: Shinjou Hinaki
character.description: Shinjou Hinaki has short, curly yellow-blond hair in a feathered bob with a braid that goes across the right side of her forehead clipped with an orange star. Her eyes are a piercing lime-green. She`s a fashionable girl who knows a lot about Aikatsu! Cards.

character.name: Guppy
character.description: Guppy is Aoi`s inspiration as an idol and she is also a Futuring Girl user. She appeared as a flashback character in Episode 40, where she sung Summer Summer Vacation! Guppy is a fair skinned girl with orange-brown hair worn in curly twintails held by frilly pieces of material. Her bangs are straight cut, while her eyes are a bright, clear shade of blue. She often wore makeup.

character.name: Tristar
character.description: Idol Group formed by Mizuki starting in episode 33, with the roster being finalized in episode 38. They disbanded when Mizuki left Starlight Gakuen (episode 50). But, reformed in episode 150.

character.name: Luminas
character.description: Idol unit that was initially created to participate in the Great Starlight School Festival.

character.name: Ikenai Deka
character.description: A police television drama. The name is also used to refer to the protagonists of said drama. It also had a crossover movie with the Swallowtail franchise.

character.name: Mr. CoCo
character.description: A rat that hides under the skull http://anidb.net/ch50987 [Kurosawa Michiru] wears on her shoulder.

character.name: Nijigahara Makoto no Papa
character.description: As a student he received a love confession from http://anidb.net/ch52353 [Inamura Ikuyo]. But, rejected her due to family circumstances. He gave her half of a pendant to remember him by. He later became http://anidb.net/ch52352 [Nijigahara Makoto]`s father, and gave him the other half of the pendant.

character.name: Muleta Atsurou
character.description: is Encierro Atsuji`s disciple.

character.name: Kisaragi Lucy
character.description: Dolly Devil`s Top Designer

character.name: Tanaka Kentarou
character.description: Kindergartener of kindergarten. 6-year-old. Called ", Comedy master Ken-chan". Comedian was strictly observed in his comedy is reckoned from the entertainer idle because there is a rumor to become a popular person.

character.name: Nakaya
character.description: In employees of a major toy manufacturer "DANDAI (Dandai)", developers of the girl for the new brand "Happiness Toys".

character.name: Aurora Fantasy
character.description: Aurora Fantasy is a fashion company that specializes in fairy tale and fantasy themed clothing.

character.name: Angely Sugar
character.description: Angely Sugar is a fashion company that specializes in sweet lolita clothing.

character.name: Loli Gothic
character.description: Loli Gothic, stylized as LoLi GoThiC, is fashion company specializing in http://anidb.net/t1952 [gothic lolita] fashion.

character.name: Happy Rainbow
character.description: Happy Rainbow is a fashion company that specializing in brightly colored clothing often featuring fruit motifs.

character.name: Spicy Ageha
character.description: Spicy Ageha is a fashion company specializing in elegant clothing.

character.name: Love Queen
character.description: Love Queen is a fashion company that makes clothing exclusively for http://anidb.net/ch47565 [Kanzaki Mizuki].

character.name: Magical Toy
character.description: Magical Toy is a fashion company specializing in the clothing inspired by amusement parks and carnivals.

character.name: Marcel
character.description: Marcel is a clown and the top designer of http://anidb.net/ch80966 [Magical Toy].

character.name: Soleil
character.description: Soleil is an idol group created by http://anidb.net/ch48466 [Mitsuishi Orihime] to rival http://anidb.net/ch77471 [Tristar]. It original consisted of http://anidb.net/ch47564 [Hoshimiya Ichigo] and http://anidb.net/ch47567 [Kiriya Aoi]. However, http://anidb.net/ch47566 [Shibuki Ran] joined right before their first concert.

character.name: Kayoko
character.description: The top designer of ViVid Kiss, Mikuru & Hinaki`s favored brand. She lives in LA.

character.name: Encierro Atsushi
character.description: Top designer of Sangria Rosa, Juri`s favored brand.

character.name: Momoi Mika
character.description: Moderator of idle information program. In the 112 episodes I have a program presenter along with the nineteen Tokui. In the first 116 episodes have a moderator of the lights of the weather caster recital together with Hosoya. In the first 141 episodes have a reporter of the world super-hot Fes.

character.name: Sena Tsubasa
character.description: Top designer of Dreamy Crown, Akari`s favored brand. He was Asuka Amahane`s helper at first. His dresses are often inspired by Akari`s bright and cheerful personality. He has designed most of Akari`s premium dresses. He is the youngest known designer, at the age of 16-17.

character.name: Shirai Misako
character.description: Moderator of "Ohayo Watch"

character.name: Shirakaba Reiko
character.description: Lisa`s mother.

character.description: Lisa`s father. Close to the earth house.

character.name: Kurebayashi Karen
character.description: The mother of Juri Kurebayashi. She is a famous actress.

character.name: Nagasawa Toshio
character.description: Moderator of "Ohayo watch".

character.name: Alan
character.description: Who admitted Yurika that was declared to be the idol worthy of Lori Gothic than, pass a premium card. Because constellation dress was unfinished in the first 89 episodes, when it is completed by the use to Alan, Capricorn was passing constellation premium dress, the Nightmare Capricorn Corde to Yurika.

character.name: Camino Serio
character.description: Karen Kurebayashi`s husband and Juri`s father. He is a well known Spanish chef.

character.name: Sany
character.description: Top designer of dark color and pointing color of neon colors in a cool silver sensational brand "Dance Fusion (dance fusion)." It is also famous as a dancer of the legend, once had formed a dance team "Sunny & Johnny" with Johnny Beppu

character.name: Kowashi Ayaka
character.description: TV TKY Meteorological Center weather caster.

character.name: Mizutani Ikuko
character.description: CM person in charge of the shampoo. It invites violet that has been raised as a potential candidate for the image model Odie tion, but violets were cheering her withdrew in order to advance on the road to become a singer. Then in the first 131 episodes, it was supposed to be CM production proposed along with the violet and phosphorus to light stone school that you use to shampoo of CM liked the new song of the formation unit of violets and Rin "Dancing Diva".

character.name: Hikami Azusa
character.description: Sumire`s older sister. She is very kind and protective towards her sister. She showed the Starlight Academy to Sumire and encouraged her to enroll. Her keen interest in LoLi GoThiC also deeply influences Sumire.

character.name: Hosoya-producer
character.description: Producer of "Ohayo watch". Moderator of the interviewer and the lights of the weather caster recital of the weather caster audition also served.

character.name: Pepper-gunsou
character.description: directs the "Aikatsu boot camp" on an uninhabited island, where aspiring Idols who have deficits in their performance, to be brought up to speed. The camp has a reputation for being incredibly hard and actually requires the Sergeant them at the beginning physically a lot from, but this was actually only the warm-up in the end. The accent of the instructor reveals he is from America. He also operates an idol training camp, participated in the Hoshimiya Ichigo during their one-year stay in the USA. He`s still in good memory, because, in spite of the language barrier made it, to go along with everyone else in the camp of their courage and dedication.

character.name: Mimi
character.description: Mimi is a Bohemian Sora Kazesawa met when she was little. Mimi was Sora`s inspiration for both designing and her brand Bohemian Sky.

character.name: Rei no Hisho
character.description: Rei`s Secretary

character.name: Misumi Etsuko
character.description: Female director of fashionable expedition cool Angels new series.

character.name: Saegusa Sanae
character.description: Kii`s mother. She taught Kii her current catchphrase `Ok-Ok-Okay!`. She is a doctor.

character.name: Kamishiro Rei
character.description: Kamishiro Rei is the head designer of http://anidb.net/ch84713 [Futuring Girl].

character.name: Captain Johnny
character.description: Captain Johnny is a fictional pirate and dance instructor portrayed by http://anidb.net/ch48467 [Johnny Beppu]. He was part of a cruise given to 100 fans of http://anidb.net/ch86984 [Star Anis].

character.name: Kiriya Aoi (Ikenai Deka)

character.name: Oshare Kaitou Swallowtail
character.description: The Stylish Thieves Swallowtail are a fictional pair of thieves from the movie franchise of the same name. They specialize in stealing back Aikatsu cards stolen by other thieves.

character.name: Alice (Kamiya Shion)
character.description: Alice from Alice in Wonderland as depicted in the film by http://anidb.net/ch57991 [Muraki-kantoku].
